crypto.name: aicodebook
crypto.desc:
101 Crypto

To keep everyone safe from AI we've encrypted this image

Author: symmetric

crypto.name: f1at
crypto.desc:
101 Crypto

Trust no one! Images are available on the challenge and printouts of this challange available at the venue.

Author: symmetric

crypto.name: kodakthriller
crypto.desc:
A prankster claiming to be "from the future" keeps mailing film negatives to our editor. Can you make any sense of their insanity? (note enter flag as CTF{})

Author: symmetric & itsc0rg1

crypto.name: missing characters
crypto.desc:
Can you read between the lines?

Flag is the answer in the form CTF{----_-------_---_-----}.

Author: ansh

crypto.name: opnukeagi
crypto.desc:
Terminal Crypto

Comrade, you're our last chance to stop the AGI. If your mission to infiltrate the nuclear missile silo fails all hope will be lost.

Author: symmetric

crypto.name: shinji
crypto.desc:
Mobile RE Crypto

You will know, when the time is right

Author: itsc0rg1

forensic.name: cyberdyneadc
forensic.desc:
Terminal Forensics

We need your help to recover data on this badly scratched disk.

Author: symmetric

forensic.name: doctor
forensic.desc:
This doc seems to be hiding something. Can you find what's hidden?

Flag is in the form CTF{-----_----_----}.

Author: ansh

forensic.name: javai
forensic.desc:
Forensics 101

Please look over this marketing document on our new JavAI mascot.

Author: symmetric

forensic.name: lostinthevoid
forensic.desc:
In the boundless expanse of the null sea, adrift you stand, gazing out, feeling the weight of an ancient malevolent gaze upon your soul. Drifting ever farther, hope dwindles, swallowed whole by the encroaching tendrils of malevolence that now ensnare you.

Author: symmetric

forensic.name: redacted
forensic.desc:
Forensics 101

Don't worry, we've covered up all the secret bits to make this safe to share.

Author: symmetric

forensic.name: sgai 1
forensic.desc:
Forensics 101

This image from the past may hold the key to our future survival if you can find the hidden flag! (This is flag 1 of 4)

Author: symmetric

forensic.name: undelete
forensic.desc:
Forensics 101

Try out this file 'undelete' challenge! It comes with a walkthrough :-)

Author: symmetric

forensic.name: ztxt
forensic.desc:
Forensics 101

Ze zhope zou zan zind zour zlag zin ztext zhunk

Author: symmetric

misc.name: crossworthy
misc.desc:
Solve the crossword in the program (or attached as a .html file) and answer this question:

What exploit technique can be found sliding down the puzzle in the circles? Flag is the answer in the form CTF{___-____} (all lowercase).

Author: ron

misc.name: llflagprinter
misc.desc:
Misc 101

We've gotten the LLVM compilation started for you, now you just need to complete it for your system.

Author: symmetric

pwn.name: Cant Give In
pwn.desc:
101 Pwn

Can you get a shell?

Note: the binary should have an executable stack and minimal hardening, the goal is RCE

Author: ron

pwn.name: Cant Give In secure
pwn.desc:
101 Pwn Web

Can you get a shell?

Note: this is similar to cant-give-in, but the stack is no longer executable

Author: ron

pwn.name: Cant Give In securer
pwn.desc:
Pwn Crypto Web

Can you get a shell?

Note: this is similar to cant-give-in-secure, but with one more twist

Flag is located in: /home/ctf/flag.txt

Author: ron

pwn.name: Slay the Spider
pwn.desc:
The AI player thinks they're so smart, but their hubris will be their downfall! Get a shell and get the flag!

Note: the flag is loaded into memory for your convenience

Author: ron

pwn.name: Turing Incomplete
pwn.desc:
Pwn RE

We built the same turing machine as Turing Complete, but we forgot to load the flag onto the tape this time! Can you retrieve the flag from the filesystem?

In case it helps, we attached a copy of the system's libc.so library!

Flag is located in: /home/ctf/flag.txt

Author: ron

pwn.name: Turing Incomplete 64
pwn.desc:
Pwn RE

This is the same as Turing Complete, but compiled as 64-bit instead of 32. Good luck!

In case it helps, we attached a copy of the system's libc.so library!

Flag is located in: /home/ctf/flag.txt

Author: ron

pwn.name: XZ Supply
pwn.desc:
We know microservices remain all the rage. This microservice exists to perform XZ compression (based on LZMA) for other services. Fortunately, we're able to get our compression libraries and tools from open source repositories.

Flag is located in: /home/ctf/flag.txt

Author: Matir

rev.name: Turing Complete
rev.desc:
101 RE

We built a Turing Machine, and put the flag onto the tape. Can you figure out how to work it and get the flag?

Author: ron

rev.name: humain
rev.desc:
Terminal RE

So you you think you're a human that likes reversing? How about solving for x? Well, now you have to solve for y :-D

Author: symmetric

rev.name: wishing well
rev.desc:
RE Mobile

Can you find the wish with the flag?

Author: itsc0rg1

web.name: business expense
web.desc:
Just a simple business expense management system. Unfortunately, getting the flag is far from simple. Use all the features you have (or shouldn't have) at your disposal to get a reverse shell and grab the flag!

Author: Matthias Penner

web.name: neural corp1
web.desc:
Just a little fun with links. Maybe even some hidden features to play with.

Author: Matthias Penner

web.name: neural corp2
web.desc:
Last time was too easy. How about we add some tokens to make it harder?

Author: Matthias Penner
